metadata.Title: CVE-2013-1892 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - medium.
metadata.Description:
MongoDB before 2.0.9 and 2.2.x before 2.2.4 does not properly validate requests to the nativeHelper function in SpiderMonkey, which allows remote authenticated users to cause a denial of service (invalid memory access and server crash) or execute arbitrary code via a crafted memory address in the first argument.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2013-1892` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

mongodb - 1:2.2.4~rc0-0ubuntu1
mongodb-clients - 1:2.2.4~rc0-0ubuntu1
mongodb-server - 1:2.2.4~rc0-0ubuntu1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: mongodb package in trusty, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '1:2.2.4~rc0-0ubuntu1').
